intro: Chevaliera tayoensis, commonly known as the Tayanese Chevaliera, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
